intro: Dyssochroma viridiflorum, commonly known as the greenflower dyssochroma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
